revision.text:
{{short description|2006 single by Justin Timberlake}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{See Wiktionary||what goes around comes around|phrase}} {{Infobox song | name = What Goes Around... Comes Around | cover = What Goes Around... Comes Around.png | alt = | border = yes | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[FutureSex/LoveSounds]] | B-side = Boutique in Heaven | released = {{Start date|2006|12|19}} | format = {{hlist|[[12-inch single|12"]]|[[CD single|CD]]|digital download}} | recorded = 2005 | studio = {{hlist|Thomas Crown Studios ([[Virginia Beach, Virginia|Virginia Beach]])|The Studio ([[Philadelphia]])}} | venue = | genre = <!--Do not add unsourced genres --> | length = {{ubl|7:29 {{small|(album version)}}|5:13 {{small|(radio edit)}}}} | label = {{hlist|[[Jive Records|Jive]]|[[Zomba Group of Companies|Zomba]]}} | writer = {{hlist|Justin Timberlake|[[Timbaland|Tim Mosley]]|[[Danja (producer)|Nate "Danja" Hills]]}} | producer = {{hlist|[[Timbaland]]|Justin Timberlake|Nate "Danja" Hills}} | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | type = singles | prev_title = [[Dick in a Box]] | prev_year = 2006 | title = What Goes Around... Comes Around | year = 2006 | next_title = [[Give It to Me (Timbaland song)|Give It to Me]] | next_year = 2007 }} {{External music video|{{YouTube|TOrnUquxtwA|"What Goes Around... Comes Around"}}}} }}
"'''What Goes Around.../...Comes Around (Interlude)'''" is a song recorded by American singer and songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]] for his second studio album, ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'' (2006). It was written and produced by Timberlake, [[Timbaland]], and [[Danja (producer)|Danja]]. The song was said by Timberlake to be about betrayal and forgiveness, and was described by some music critics as a "sequel" to his 2002 single "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]". The song received generally positive reviews from music critics.
The song was retitled "'''What Goes Around... Comes Around'''" for its December 19, 2006, release as the third single from ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''. It became Timberlake's third consecutive number-one hit on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. Internationally the song was also successful, reaching the top ten in countries such as the United Kingdom, Canada, New Zealand, Germany, and Australia. The song was later certified two-times [[List of music recording certifications|platinum]] in Australia, [[RIAA certification|gold]] in the United States and [[List of music recording certifications|gold]] in New Zealand. The song won [[Grammy Award for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance|Best Male Pop Vocal Performance]] at the [[50th Grammy Awards]], where it also received a nomination for [[Record of the Year]].
The [[Samuel Bayer]]-directed music video for "What Goes Around... Comes Around" was released February 7, 2007. Actress [[Scarlett Johansson]] plays Timberlake's love interest in the video. The video received the award for [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Direction|Best Direction]] at the [[2007 MTV Video Music Awards]] and was also nominated for [[MTV Video Music Award for Video of the Year|Video of the Year]].
==Production== [[Image:Justin in a Piano.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Justin Timberlake on a piano while singing "What Goes Around..."]] When Timberlake began working on ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' at [[Timbaland]]'s studio in [[Virginia Beach, Virginia]],<ref name="Jennifer">{{cite news |last=Vineyard |first=Jennifer |title=Road to the Grammys: Justin Wanted To Channel Coldplay On FutureSex/LoveSounds |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1552019/20070208/timberlake_justin.jhtml |publisher=MTV News |date=February 9, 2007 |accessdate=February 15, 2008}}</ref><ref name="Vineyard">{{Cite news|last=Vineyard |first=Jennifer |title=Justin Timberlake's Fooling 'Around' Resulted in Award-Nominated Song: Behind The Grammys |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1581045/20080206/timberlake_justin.jhtml |publisher=MTV News |date=February 8, 2008 |accessdate=February 15, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mtv.com%2Fnews%2Farticles%2F1581045%2F20080206%2Ftimberlake_justin.jhtml&date=2011-09-29 |archivedate=September 29, 2011 }}</ref> they had no idea of what the album would be like with no plan for it or even a title.<ref name="Vineyard"/> He told his collaborators to do a remake of his previous single, "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]".<ref name="Vineyard"/> Danja, a protégé of Timbaland, stated: "We had no direction at all other than 'Cry Me a River,' and not in the sense of mimicking the track, but in how big the song was. There was no direction for how he wanted the song to sound, because there was no direction for how he wanted [his album ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''] to sound."<ref name="Vineyard"/>
The song was written and produced by Justin Timberlake, Timbaland, and [[Danja (musician)|Nate "Danja" Hills]]. While in the studio, the three men were just "fooling around" and "freestyling".<ref name="Vineyard"/> When Danja began playing a guitar [[riff]], it caught Timberlake's attention. Timberlake started humming to the [[melody]], and then the lyrics came. Timbaland, who was at his keyboards beside Danja, added drums to the melody. Danja commented that "everything was coming together at the same time".<ref name="Vineyard"/> After coming up with the music, Timberlake never wrote down the lyrics and, in an hour, he was ready to record it. By the time Timberlake was in the vocal booth, the basic track was done, then Timbaland produced a [[prelude (music)|prelude]] of the song. Timberlake sang the song in a couple of takes and went back line by line to fill up the gaps. During the recording sessions, Timbaland and Danja added everything else, including the basses and strings. Danja compared the process to scoring to a movie, thinking the song was like a horror flick.<ref name="Vineyard"/>
"What Goes Around... Comes Around" was pivotal to the creation of ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''. After finishing the production of the song, Timbaland teased Timberlake. Timberlake responded: "Let's do something we would never do. Let's go far left and just see what happens."<ref name="Vineyard"/> His answer motivated the collective, and they ended up producing ten songs for the album.<ref name="Jennifer"/>
==Composition and interpretation== {{listen|filename=Justin Timberlake - What Goes Around...-...Comes Around.ogg|title="What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" |description=A sample of "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" |pos=right |format=[[Ogg]]}} "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" is performed in a slow manner.<ref name="Sheet">{{cite web |title=Justin Timberlake Digital Sheet Music: What Goes Around |url=http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppn=MN0056580 |work=Musicnotes |accessdate=February 13, 2008}}</ref> It is composed in the [[key (music)|key]] of A [[Dorian mode|Dorian]] ([[A Minor]]) in [[common time]]. With a gentle and midtempo beat,<ref name="Lamb">{{cite web |last=Lamb |first=Bill |title=Justin Timberlake "What Goes Around..."(review) |url=http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/jtwhatgoes.htm |work=About entertainment |accessdate=January 15, 2007 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/668mBLEBz?url=http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/jtwhatgoes.htm |archive-date=March 13, 2012 |url-status=dead }}</ref> the tempo is pacing to 76 [[beats per minute]].<ref name="Sheet"/> The song features a two-minute [[Break (music)|interlude]] titled "Comes Around", featuring the album's producer [[Timbaland]], spanning to a seven-minute and 28-second track. Timberlake's voice ranges from B<sub>2</sub> to C<sub>5</sub>.<ref name="Sheet"/> Musically, the song is similar to the type of music produced on Timberlake's ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' album; however, it is the only link from ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' to ''Justified''.<ref name="Moss">{{Cite news|last=Moss |first=Corey |title=Justin's Future Shock |url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/t/timberlake_justin/news_feature_081506/index2.jhtml |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=February 15, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121106121310/http://www.mtv.com/bands/t/timberlake_justin/news_feature_081506/index2.jhtml |archivedate=November 6, 2012 }}</ref>
In the beginning of the song, there is a five-second harmony line of two [[bağlama]]s (one each panned far left and far right on respect octaves), a Turkish folk instrument. The beat is then changed to a more upbeat version of the same melody with more percussion. The basic ornamentation is loyal to characteristic Turkish string ornamentations. Timbaland also used the Turkish oud to mellow out the guitar [[riff]].<ref name="Vineyard"/> The chord series follows the Am-C-G-D keys. Following the instrumental, Timberlake begins the verse at thirteenth [[bar (music)|bar]]. The original track had a [[bridge (music)|bridge]], including the pre-verses, the verses and the choruses. After hearing the vocals of Timberlake, they decided to remove the bridge and follow a simple flow, because they felt its "too much" to have it and a [[break (music)|break]] at the end of the song.<ref name="Vineyard"/> Timbaland provides backing vocals on the song.
"What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" is about betrayal and forgiveness.<ref name="SonyBMGAus">{{Cite news |title=JT Comes Around With New Single in Stores This Saturday |url=http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004359 |work=Sony BMG Australia |date=March 17, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070909094326/http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004359 |archive-date=September 9, 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Timberlake revealed that the song was written for the experience his friend went through.<ref name="Moss"/> However, the public came up with different interpretation of the lyrics, that being a sequel to "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me A River]]". Bill Lamb wrote that the song has a "cautionary tale in the lyrics".<ref name="Lamb"/> According to him, many fans and critics alike, after hearing the song, insisted that it is similar in meaning to "Cry Me a River", which allegedly accounts to Timberlake's relationship with former girlfriend, pop singer [[Britney Spears]].<ref name="Lamb"/> However, Timberlake's account of the song's meaning contradicts this. Spence D. of [[IGN]] commented that the song presents "some intriguing ambiance".<ref name="Spence"/>
==Reception==
===Critical reception=== {{Quote box|width=300px|align=right|quote="With an instantly recognizable introduction, Timberlake teaches a master class on consequences."|source=— [[VH1]]'s Emily Exton in 2013.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.vh1.com/news/51659/justin-timberlake-greatest-songs/ |title=Let The Groove Get In: Justin Timberlake’s 20 Greatest Songs |date=October 4, 2013 |publisher=VH1 |access-date=June 21, 2017}}</ref>}} The song received generally positive reviews from critics. ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' called the single "a soaring ballad featuring Timberlake's falsetto, with verses and choruses that pile on top of one another with dizzying effect."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Scaggs |first=Austin |title=Timberlake Returns |newspaper=Rolling Stone |date=July 13, 2007 |postscript=<!--None-->}}</ref> [[About.com]] reviewer Bill Lamb stated that the song "is one of the most gorgeous pop melodies of the year." He complimented the string-based arrangement of the song.<ref name="Lamb"/> Chris Willman of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' called it "superior", along with "[[LoveStoned]]".<ref>{{cite news |last=Willman |first=Chris |title=FutureSex/LoveSounds (2006): Justin Timberlake |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,1532765,00.html |work=Entertainment Weekly |publisher=Entertainment Weekly and Time Inc. |date=September 8, 2006 |accessdate=February 22, 2008}}</ref> Zach Baron of [[Pitchfork Media]] referred to it "some real can't-let-go shit that'll save you the repeat stabs on the bad night."<ref>{{cite web |last=Baron |first=Zach |title=Justin Timberlake: "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around Interlude" |url=http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/track_review/38235-what-goes-aroundcomes-around-interlude |work=Pitchfork Media |publisher=Pitchfork Media Inc. |date=September 1, 2006 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080307125906/http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/track_review/38235-what-goes-aroundcomes-around-interlude |archive-date=March 7, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Spence D. of [[IGN]] called it "annoying" but he complimented the use of echo vocals and swirling synths.<ref name="Spence">{{cite web |last=D. |first=Spence |title=Justin Timberlake – Futuresex/Lovesounds |url=http://music.ign.com/articles/732/732876p1.html |work=IGN |date=September 14, 2006 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/668mBr66Q?url=http://music.ign.com/articles/732/732876p1.html |archive-date=March 13, 2012 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
In later reviews, ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s Katie Atkinson noted "with a whopping 7:28 running time, it was a very long single. But there are a lot of great pieces to this too-big puzzle."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7357881/justin-timberlake-singles-ranked-cant-stop-the-feeling |title=Critic's Choice: Every Justin Timberlake Single Ranked |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=May 6, 2016 |work=Billboard |access-date=June 18, 2017}}</ref> ''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'' staff described it as "smooth, velvety and self-assured" track, noting the singer "is not guessing that his cheating ex will be punished for her transgression—he's sure she will be."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/03/the-25-best-justin-timberlake-songs/justin-timberlake-like-i-love-you |title=The 25 Best Justin Timberlake Songs |date=March 15, 2013 |work=Complex |access-date=June 18, 2017}}</ref> [[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] staff stated, "This track is also probably what influenced many of [[Taylor Swift]] kiss-off ballad in the years to come."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.idolator.com/7634013/justin-timberlake-nsync-biggest-songs-reviewed-playlist-listen/6 |title=Justin Timberlake's 23 Top 10 Singles (Including *NSYNC!): Revisited, Reviewed & Ranked |date=May 20, 2016 |work=Idolator |access-date=June 21, 2017}}</ref>
"What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" placed at number 24 on ''Rolling Stone''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s list of the 100 Best Songs of 2007.<ref>{{cite web |title=The 100 Best Songs of 2007 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/17601363/the_100_best_songs_of_2007/6 |work=Rolling Stone |date=December 11, 2007 |accessdate=February 13, 2008}}</ref> The song was nominated twice at the [[50th Grammy Awards|50th Annual Grammy Awards]], winning Best Male Pop Vocal Performance but lost to [[Amy Winehouse]]'s "[[Rehab (Amy Winehouse song)|Rehab]]" for Record of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|title=50th Annual Grammy Awards Winners List |url=http://www.grammy.com/GRAMMY_Awards/50th_show/list.aspx |publisher=National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080223163153/http://www.grammy.com/GRAMMY_Awards/50th_Show/list.aspx |archivedate=February 23, 2008 }}</ref>
===Commercial performance=== <!-- [[Image:Justin Sings What Goes Around.jpg|thumb|250px|Justin Timberlake singing "What Goes Around..." during a live concert]] --> "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" was commercially successful in the United States. The single debuted at number 64 on December 23, 2006 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], prior to its physical release.<ref>{{cite web |title=Billboard Hot 100 |url=http://acharts.us/billboard_hot_100/2006/51 |publisher=αCharts.us |date=December 23, 2006 |accessdate=February 18, 2008 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080121133158/http://acharts.us/billboard_hot_100/2006/51 |archivedate = January 21, 2008}}</ref> From number eight on February 24, 2007,<ref>{{cite web |title=Billboard Hot 100 |url=http://acharts.us/billboard_hot_100/2007/08 |publisher=αCharts.us |date=February 24, 2007 |accessdate=February 18, 2008 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080123092934/http://acharts.us/billboard_hot_100/2007/08 |archivedate = January 23, 2008}}</ref> it propelled to number one the following week. "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" became Timberlake's third consecutive number one hit on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 from his ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' album, becoming the first male artist since [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]] in 2004 to have three or more consecutive number-one hits from one album.<ref>{{cite web |title=Chart Beat |url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/chart_beat/bonus_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003548872 |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=February 22, 2007 |accessdate=February 22, 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070302081541/http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/chart_beat/bonus_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003548872 |archivedate = March 2, 2007}}</ref> The single charted on Hot 100 for 25 weeks.<ref name="aCharts">{{cite web |title="What Goes Around..." Global Positions and Trajectories |url=http://acharts.us/song/11844 |publisher=αCharts |accessdate=February 18, 2008}}</ref> "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" was certified platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] on June 7, 2007.<ref>{{cite web |title=Gold and Platinum |url=https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1&table=SEARCH_RESULTS&action=&title=What%20Goes%20Around&artist=&format=&debutLP=&category=&sex=&releaseDate=&requestNo=&type=&level=&label=&company=&certificationDate=&awardDescription=&catalogNo=&aSex=&rec_id=&charField=&gold=&platinum=&multiPlat=&level2=&certDate=&album=&id=&after=&before=&startMonth=1&endMonth=1&startYear=1958&endYear=2008&sort=Artist&perPage=25 |publisher=Recording Industry Association of America |accessdate=February 23, 2008}}</ref> By September 3, 2010, the song had passed the two million sales plateau,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/65334/chart-watch-extra-the-ageless-tina-turner/ |title=Chart Watch Extra: The Ageless Tina Turner – Chart Watch |publisher=Yahoo! Music |accessdate=September 14, 2010 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100911203858/http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/65334/chart-watch-extra-the-ageless-tina-turner/ |archivedate=September 11, 2010 }}</ref> and has sold 2,375,000 copies as of April 2013.<ref name="chartwatch">{{cite web|url=http://music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart-watch/week-ending-april-21-2013-songs-duo-200020239.html |title=Week Ending April 21, 2013. Songs: Duo of the Year |last=Grein|first=Paul|date=April 23, 2013|accessdate=May 6, 2013}}</ref> As of 2018, the song has accumulated 3.5 million units in the US, combining sales (2.8 million copies) and equivalent streams.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.nielsen.com/us/en/insights/news/2018/the-evolution-of-super-bowl-lii-halftime-performer-justin-.timberlake.html?cid=socSprinklr-Nielsen |title=The Evolution of Super Bowl LII Half-Time Performer Justin Timberlake |date=January 31, 2018 |work=Nielsen |access-date=January 31, 2018}}</ref><ref name="us sales">{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8097976/justin-timberlake-nsync-career-album-song-sales-ask-billboard|title=Ask Billboard: Justin Timberlake & *NSYNC's Career Album & Song Sales |work=Billboard |publisher=Billboard-Hollywood Media Group |date=February 4, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018 |last=Trust |first=Gary}}</ref>
In the United Kingdom, "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" debuted at number 59 on the UK Singles Chart on January 28, 2007.<ref>{{cite web |title=UK Singles Top 75 |url=http://acharts.us/uk_singles_top_75/2007/05 |publisher=αCharts |date=January 29, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008}}</ref> The digital download sales helped propel the single to number 11 on February 25, 2007.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Justin storms the charts |url=http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4820/35/ |work=Sony BMG UK |date=February 26, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211104621/http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4820/35/ |archive-date=December 11, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" peaked at number four on March 11,<ref>{{Cite news |title=What Goes Around leaps up the charts |url=http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4966/35/ |work=Sony BMG UK |date=March 12, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211104643/http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4966/35/ |archive-date=December 11, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> to become his sixth top five single in the United Kingdom. It stayed on the chart for 22 weeks.<ref name="aCharts"/> The single entered the top five in [[Austria]], [[Belgium]], [[Denmark]], [[Finland]], France, Germany, Ireland, [[Norway]], [[Romania]], Switzerland.<ref name="aCharts"/> In Australia, the single debuted and peaked at number three on the Australian [[Australian Recording Industry Association|ARIA]] singles chart on March 26, 2007, gaining the Highest Debut certification.<ref>{{cite web |title=Australia Singles Top 50 |url=http://acharts.us/australia_singles_top_50/2007/13 |publisher=αCharts |date=March 26, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008}}</ref> It spent a total of 22 weeks on the chart.<ref name="aCharts"/> "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" was certified two-times platinum by the [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] for selling over 30,000 units.<ref>{{cite web |title=ARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2007 Singles |url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2007Singles.htm |work=Australian Recording Industry Association |publisher=Australian Recording Industry Association Ltd. |accessdate=February 23, 2008}}</ref> The single peaked at number three in the New Zealand on April 9, 2007, and spent 16 weeks on the chart.<ref name="aCharts"/><ref>{{cite web |title=New Zealand Top 40 |url=http://acharts.us/nz_singles_top_40/2007/15 |publisher=αCharts |date=April 9, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008}}</ref> "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" was certified gold by the [[Recording Industry Association of New Zealand]].<ref>{{cite web |title=RIANZ: Top 40 Singles |url=http://www.rianz.org.nz/rianz/chart.asp?chartNum=1569&chartKind=S |publisher=Recording Industry Association of New Zealand |date=June 18, 2007 |accessdate=March 20, 2008 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/668mPnizx?url=http://www.rianz.org.nz/rianz/chart.asp?chartNum=1569&chartKind=S |archive-date=March 13, 2012 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
==Music video==
===Development=== [[File:ScarlettJohanssonFeb07.jpg|thumb|right|upright|alt=A close up of a smiling young woman, her blonde hair pulled back, wearing a silver tiara, silver earrings and a black cowl-necked coat. She is standing outside in bright sunlight.|Director [[Samuel Bayer]] and Timberlake chose American actress [[Scarlett Johansson]] after deciding on using "real" actors for the music video to "What Goes Around... Comes Around".<ref name="Vineyard2"/>]] The music video for the "What Goes Around... Comes Around" was produced as a short movie.<ref name="Vineyard2">{{Cite news |last=Vineyard |first=Jennifer |title=Justin Timberlake Went 'Around' And Came Out with a Broken Finger: VMA Lens Recap |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1568745/20070831/timberlake_justin.jhtml |publisher=MTV News |date=September 4, 2007 |accessdate=February 19, 2008}}</ref><ref name="SonyVid">{{Cite news |title=It's Here! Watch The New Justin Timberlake Video NOW |url=http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004235 |work=Sony BMG Australia |date=February 19, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080525112211/http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004235 |archive-date=May 25, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> The video was directed by [[Samuel Bayer]], who had first directorial works with [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]'s 1991 single "[[Smells Like Teen Spirit]]".<ref name="Vineyard2"/><ref name="SonyVid"/> The video features dialogues written by ''[[Alpha Dog]]'' writer and director [[Nick Cassavetes]], who had previously worked with Timberlake in the film.<ref name="Vineyard2"/><ref name="SonyVid"/> Timberlake and Bayer enlisted American actress [[Scarlett Johansson]] after deciding on using "real" actors.<ref name="Vineyard2"/> The shooting went for three days between Christmas and New Year's Eve 2006 in Los Angeles.<ref name="Vineyard2"/> The dawn scene was shot on January 8, after the original sessions were done.<ref name="Vineyard2"/>
===Synopsis=== The video starts off with Timberlake flirting with Johansson on the [[burlesque]]-style club. She rejects with a tease at first but eventually leaves with him to go back to his place. In between cuts, they are shown in bed caressing each other. Johansson jumps into a pool outside the house, and floats below the surface as if she is drowning. Timberlake runs out and pulls her up; she laughs at Timberlake and kisses him.
In another scene, Timberlake introduces her to a drunk [[Shawn Hatosy]] at the club calling her "The One". Hatosy seems to be interested in Johansson and Timberlake asks him to "keep an eye on her for me", perhaps suspecting she has another man on the side. Timberlake returns and finds them kissing in the stairway. After punching Hatosy, he chases after Johansson, who speeds off in her 1967 [[Chevrolet Corvette (C2)|Corvette Sting Ray]]; Timberlake follows in his [[Porsche Carrera GT]]. Johansson runs into a fiery car crash pile up and is ejected from the car as it tumbles through the air and lands several feet away 2 times. Timberlake notices Johansson's motionless body lying supine on the ground. He gets out and kneels over her while the camera view moves toward the sky. The end of the video references the ending of 1960 movie [[BUtterfield 8]] in which Gloria, the main character portrayed by [[Elizabeth Taylor]], dies in the same manner, with the scenes sharing many similar shots.
Some scenes shows Timberlake performing on the stairway with a microphone while a group of unknown girls with red paint on their eyes are seen dancing next to him while one (Johansson) is seen waving her batons with fire on them near the end of the video.
===Release and reception=== The music video of "What Goes Around... Comes Around" was exclusively premiered on February 9, 2007 on the [[iTunes Store]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Justin Timberlake Introduces His Highly Anticipated Video 'What Goes Around ... Comes Around' Friday February 9th on iTunes |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT=104&STORY=/www/story/02-08-2007/0004524063&EDATE= |agency=PR Newswire |date=February 8, 2007 |accessdate=February 20, 2008}}</ref> The music video debuted on [[MTV]]'s ''[[Total Request Live]]'' at number nine on February 13, 2007.<ref>{{cite web|title=TRL Debuts |url=http://host17.hrwebservices.net/~atrl/trlarchive/db.html |publisher=Popfusion |accessdate=February 20, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080102172613/http://host17.hrwebservices.net/~atrl/trlarchive/db.html |archivedate=January 2, 2008 }}</ref> "What Goes Around..." retired on May 7 at number seven.<ref>{{cite web|title=TRL Hall of Fame |url=http://host17.hrwebservices.net/~atrl/trlarchive/rd.html |publisher=Popfusion |accessdate=February 20, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927235336/http://host17.hrwebservices.net/~atrl/trlarchive/rd.html |archivedate=September 27, 2007 }}</ref> In Canada, the music video debuted on [[Muchmusic]]'s Top 30 countdown at number 22 on January 26, 2007.<ref name="Top40">{{cite web |title=Justin Timberlake: What Goes Around |url=http://top40-charts.com/songs/full.php?sid=18863&sort=chartid |publisher=Top40-charts.com |accessdate=May 26, 2007}}</ref> It peaked at number one on April 27 and stayed on the chart for seven non-consecutive weeks.<ref name="Top40"/> The video was commercially successful, becoming the fastest selling pop promo on [[iTunes]].<ref name="SonyBMGUKVid">{{Cite news |title=Justin Sells Loads on iTunes |url=http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4785/35/ |work=Sony BMG UK |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211104604/http://www.sonybmgmusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4785/35/ |archive-date=December 11, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> It has sold 50,000 in downloads for four days.<ref name="SonyBMGUKVid"/><ref>{{Cite news |title=JT's What Goes Around Comes Around Blitzes iTunes! 50,000 Downloads Already Sold |url=http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004259 |work=Sony BMG Australia |date=February 22, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080816010307/http://www.sonymusic.com.au/news/details.do?newsId=20030829004259 |archive-date=August 16, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Timberlake was the first major artist to release a video on the download platform.<ref name="SonyBMGUKVid"/>
In September 2007, "What Goes Around... Comes Around" won an [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Award]] for [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Direction|Best Direction]].<ref name="VMA">{{cite web |title=2007 VMA Winners |url=http://www.mtv.com/ontv/vma/2007/winners.jhtml |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=February 20, 2008}}</ref> It was also nominated for Video of the Year but lost to singer [[Rihanna]]'s 2007 video "[[Umbrella (song)|Umbrella]]".<ref name="VMA"/><ref>{{Cite news |last=Boehm |first=Kristin |title=Justin Timberlake, Beyoncé Top VMA Nominations |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20050372,00.html |work=People |date=August 7, 2007 |accessdate=February 20, 2008}}</ref>
==Live performances== Timberlake performed the song on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''.<ref>{{cite episode |title=Justin Timberlake |episode-link=Saturday Night Live (season 32) |series=Saturday Night Live |credits= |network=[[NBC]] |station= |airdate=December 16, 2006 |season=[[Saturday Night Live (season 32)|32]] |number=9 |minutes=90–92 }}</ref> Timberlake performed twice at the [[49th Annual Grammy Awards]], once at the piano for "What Goes Around Comes Around" and later "[[My Love (Justin Timberlake song)|My Love]]" and Bill Withers' "[[Ain't No Sunshine]]."<ref>{{cite web |title=Grammy Performances Look Forward And Back |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1055083/grammy-performances-look-forward-and-back |work=Billboard |last=Hasty |first= Katie |date= February 12, 2007|access-date=December 29, 2014}}</ref> The song is featured in the set list of [[FutureSex/LoveShow]] (2007), [[Legends of the Summer]] (2013), [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour]] (2013/14) and the [[Man of the Woods Tour]] (2018/19). Timberlake performed the song along with [[Shawn Mendes]] at the 2018 [[iHeartRadio Music Festival]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/festivals/8476454/justin-timberlake-shawn-mendes-2018-iheartradio-music-festival-what-comes-around-goes-around-video |title=Justin Timberlake Opens 2018 iHeartRadio Music Festival Day 2 With Shawn Mendes Assist on 'What Goes Around' |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=September 22, 2018 |work=Billboard |access-date=September 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Cover versions== On May 23, 2007, [[Marilyn Manson]] and [[Tim Skold]] appeared on UK radio station [[BBC Radio 1]]'s program ''[[Live Lounge]]'' to promote [[Marilyn Manson (band)|Marilyn Manson]]'s 2007 album ''[[Eat Me, Drink Me]]''. They performed an acoustic version of "[[Heart-Shaped Glasses (When the Heart Guides the Hand)]]", followed with an acoustic cover of "What Goes Around... Comes Around". The Manson cover does not include the interlude.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Marilyn Manson On UK's Radio 1's Live Lounge. Alesana also performed a cover of the song in the soon to be released "Punk Goes Pop Volume 2" |url=http://www.mansonusa.com/headlines/fullnews.php?id=466 |work=Mansonusa.com |publisher=The Heirophant, Filicide Ent. |date=May 23, 2007 |accessdate=February 23, 2008 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071228102058/http://www.mansonusa.com/headlines/fullnews.php?id=466 |archivedate=December 28, 2007 }}</ref> On May 28, 2007, Dutch singer [[Esmée Denters]] posted a version of the song on YouTube accompanied by Justin Timberlake on piano and backing vocals. At the conclusion, he says, "She sings my song better than me." Timberlake later produced Denters' debut album, ''[[Outta Here (album)|Outta Here]]''.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=69Grnh7Qin8 | title=me singing ``what goes around`` Justin Timberlake | via=YouTube | date=May 28, 2007 | accessdate=February 27, 2017}}</ref> French singer [[Myriam Abel]], the winner of [[Nouvelle Star|Nouvelle Star 3]], also recorded a non-commercial cover of "What Goes Around.../...Comes Around" with a [[Raï]] influence, accessible through her official [[MySpace]] page.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.myspace.com/myriamabelofficiel |title=Myriam Abel op MySpace Music – Gratis gestreamde MP3's, foto's en Videoclips |publisher=Myspace.com |accessdate=September 14, 2010}}{{Primary source inline|date=January 2020}}</ref> An a cappella rendition was recorded by [[Overboard (a cappella)|Overboard]] for their 2007 album, ''Stranded''. American post hardcore band [[Alesana]] recorded a cover for the [[Punk Goes...]] compilation series, ''[[Punk Goes Pop 2]]'', released March 10, 2009. [[Taylor Swift]] performed a mashup of "[[You're Not Sorry]]" and "What Goes Around... Comes Around" during her [[Fearless Tour]] (2009–10).<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/taylor-swift-shepherds-bush-empire-london-1682504.html | title=Taylor Swift, Shepherd's Bush Empire, London | work=The Independent | date=May 10, 2009 | accessdate=April 27, 2016 | author=Orr, Guillian}}</ref> Benny Davis, of the Australian musical comedy act [[The Axis of Awesome]], also heavily sampled the song on his track "Another Four Chords" on ''The Human Jukebox'' EP, released in 2013.
